page.title: 04CHURCH
page.content: The parish church of St.Peter is a small stone church which was probably built during the twelfth century. Since then the church has seen much restoration and improvement,much of which was organised and paid for by the Rev.John Pinder,during the nineteenth century. The improvements included the building of a bell tower with six bells;a church clock,given by two sisters as a gift to the parishioners;an organ,paid for by the parishioners,and a stained glass window given by the wife of Rev.Pinder. The present rector of the church is the Rev.John Hornby. The church is used by residents of Bratton Fleming and surrounding hamlets. Sunday services are held at 9.45a.m. and 6.30p.m. There are also two chapels,one Baptist,one Methodist.
